alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Loup (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 12 at 2:48PM CDT until May 12 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Garfield County in north central Nebraska... East Central Loup County in north central Nebraska... * Until 600 PM CDT. * At 248 PM CDT, emergency management reported flash flood in Burwell with water over roads on the Burwell area. Thunderstorms producing heavy rain will continue across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 to 2 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Burwell, Calamus Reservoir State Recreation Area, Virginia Smith Dam, Homestead Knolls Campground, Deverre, Nunda Shoal Campground, Valley View Flat Campground and Hannamon Bayou Campground. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
